data.title: Staying On Top Of Technology Trends: 12 Incredible AI Sites To Explore
data.meta_description: Artificial Intelligence (AI) is a rapidly growing field that has the potential to revolutionise the way we live and work. From natural language processing and computer vision, to machine learning and…
data.text:
01. Open AI

OpenAI is a research company that aims to promote and develop friendly AI in a responsible way. The company conducts research in various areas of AI, including machine learning, computer vision, and natural language processing, and releases its findings and tools to the public. OpenAI also offers a range of AI-powered products and services for businesses and developers.

02. Google AI

Google AI is a division of Google that is focused on developing and promoting AI technology. The company conducts research in various areas of AI and releases its findings to the public. Google AI also offers a range of AI-powered products and services, including Google Cloud AI Platform and Google AI Platform.

03. DeepMind

DeepMind is a leading AI research company that was acquired by Google in 2015. The company conducts research in various areas of AI, including machine learning, computer vision, and natural language processing. DeepMind has made significant contributions to the field of AI, including the development of AlphaGo, the first computer program to defeat a world champion in the game of Go.

04. IBM Watson

IBM Watson is a suite of AI services and tools offered by IBM, including natural language processing, machine learning, and more. Watson offers a range of products and services for businesses and developers, including Watson Assistant, Watson Studio, and Watson Discovery.

05. Microsoft AI

Microsoft AI is a division of Microsoft that focuses on the development and application of AI technology. The company conducts research in various areas of AI and releases its findings to the public. Microsoft AI also offers a range of AI-powered products and services, including Microsoft Azure AI and Microsoft Dynamics 365 AI.

06. NVIDIA Deep Learning Institute

NVIDIA’s Deep Learning Institute offers a range of training programs and resources for developers and data scientists. The Institute offers online and in-person courses, workshops, and developer guides to help people learn about deep learning and how to apply it to their work.

07. AWS AI

Amazon Web Services (AWS) AI is a collection of AI services and tools offered by AWS, including machine learning, natural language processing, and more. AWS AI offers a range of products and services for businesses and developers, including Amazon SageMaker, Amazon Transcribe, and Amazon Translate.

08. Intel AI

Intel AI is a division of Intel Corporation that focuses on the development and application of AI technology. The company conducts research in various areas of AI, including machine learning, computer vision, and natural language processing. Intel AI also offers a range of AI-powered products and services, including hardware, software and solutions. The company’s hardware products include Intel Xeon Scalable processors, Intel Nervana Neural Network Processor (NNP), and Intel Movidius VPUs, specifically designed to accelerate machine learning workloads. The company’s software products include the Intel Distribution of OpenVINO toolkit, which provides a set of tools and libraries for computer vision and deep learning, and the Intel Optimization for TensorFlow, which provides optimized performance for TensorFlow on Intel architecture. Additionally, Intel AI solutions are used in various industries such as healthcare, manufacturing, and finance. Overall, Intel AI is focused on providing the best performance and efficiency for AI workloads and providing a wide range of AI solutions for businesses and developers.

09. PyTorch

PyTorch is an open-source machine learning library developed by Facebook. It is widely used for a variety of machine learning tasks, including deep learning and computer vision. PyTorch is also used by researchers and businesses to develop and deploy machine learning models.

10. DataRobot

DataRobot is a leading provider of automated machine learning (AutoML) software. The company’s platform allows organizations to build, deploy, and manage machine learning models more quickly and easily than traditional methods. DataRobot’s software automates the process of selecting and training the best models, allowing data scientists and analysts to focus on more high-value tasks such as feature engineering and model interpretability. Additionally, the platform also offers a range of advanced features such as automatic data preprocessing, hyperparameter tuning, and deployment. It can be integrated with various data sources and can be used to support many industries such as finance, healthcare, and retail. DataRobot is used by organizations of all sizes, from small businesses to large enterprises, to improve their decision-making capabilities and gain insights from their data.

11. Keras

Keras is an open-source deep learning library written in Python. It is a high-level library that makes it easy to build, train, and deploy deep learning models. Keras is widely used by researchers and businesses to develop and deploy machine learning models.

12. Salesforce Einstein

Salesforce Einstein is an artificial intelligence (AI) platform developed by Salesforce. It is integrated into the Salesforce CRM (customer relationship management) system and provides a range of AI-powered features such as natural language processing, computer vision, and predictive analytics. Salesforce Einstein is designed to help businesses automate tasks, gain insights from their data, and make more informed decisions.

The platform provides a set of pre-built AI models that can be used out of the box to perform tasks such as sentiment analysis, object detection, and lead scoring. It also allows businesses to create their own custom models using their own data. Additionally, Salesforce Einstein provides a range of features that make it easy to integrate AI into existing Salesforce workflows and processes, such as Einstein Discovery (a platform for creating predictive models), Einstein Language (NLP capabilities), Einstein Vision (image recognition) and Einstein Prediction Builder (a platform for creating custom predictions)

Overall, Salesforce Einstein is designed to make it easy for businesses to add AI capabilities to their CRM system and gain insights from their customer data.

Conclusion

In conclusion, there are many different AI websites and platforms available to businesses and individuals looking to leverage the power of AI. These range from large, well-established companies like IBM Watson and Microsoft Azure to open-source libraries like PyTorch and Keras. Each platform offers a unique set of features and capabilities, and it is important to consider the specific needs and goals of your project when choosing which platform to use. Some of the platforms like DataRobot and Intel AI are focused on automating the machine learning process and providing a wide range of solutions for businesses. While other platforms like Salesforce Einstein and IBM Watson are focused on providing AI-powered features for specific industries and use cases such as CRM and healthcare. Ultimately, by understanding the capabilities and limitations of different AI websites, organisations can make informed decisions about how to best leverage AI to drive growth and innovation.

Key takeaways:

AI websites provide access to powerful algorithms that enable users to quickly develop applications with advanced capabilities

Different platforms offer different features tailored towards specific business needs

Pricing plans range from free accounts for small projects up to enterprise-level solutions

No coding experience necessary — simply upload data into the platform in order start building your application
